messages.title: Enough is Enough
messages.content: School cuts are damaging our children's education

messages.title: Climate Emergency in Action
messages.content: It was great to see so many people speaking out at the Global Climate Strike on the 20th September. Newcastle Labour are leading the fight against climate change.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reverse cutbacks in funding to schools, ensure schools are fully staffed and rebuild/refurnish dilapidated schools.
Take action on climate change, support climate strikes, promote clean energy, and reduce carbon emissions.
Tackle air pollution by implementing new proposals following a public consultation.

issues.brexitEurope: Introduce a new referendum on EU membership.
issues.economy: Introducing a Real Living Wage of £10 an hour and ending Universal Credit.
issues.education: Restore Educational Maintenance Allowance (EMA) and scrap Ofsted.
issues.environment: Support for the Global Climate Strike and commitments to fast-track the creation of new jobs in the green industry.
issues.health: Scrap prescription charges and provide a 'National Care Service'.

quotes.text: We are looking at how we can achieve more, including how we could introduce a levy on bus companies operating in high pollution areas.

images.caption: Parks Trust Update photo with Jeremy Beecham and Rob Higgins.
Greening Denton Burn photo with Jeremy Beecham and Hazel Stephenson.
Photo of St. Cuthberts with comment on work to improve air quality.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet contains specific policy announcements, local constituency issues, and a focus on air quality and the environment.
